cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 185 miles NW of the western tip of Cuba and 395 miles SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico, forecast to bend slightly west and cross the southeast Louisiana coast before turning west inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast near or just west of the Mouth of the Mississippi River / Morgan City area

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch Sabine Pass TX to Morgan City LA; Hurricane Watch Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City; Tropical Storm Watch MS/AL border to AL/FL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City LA to Mouth of Pearl River; Storm Surge Warning Morgan City LA to Ocean Springs MS; Tropical Storm Warning Mouth of Pearl River to MS/AL border including Lake Pontchartrain/Lake Maurepas/Metro New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana coast from Intracoastal City eastward to the Mississippi/Alabama border, greatest impacts near Morgan City-New Orleans-Mississippi River delta
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (35–45 mph sustained, gusts up to 50 mph) possible late Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the inland port location (surge 4–6 ft confined to coastal marshes south of Baton Rouge)
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands may bring 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inches causing brief urban/river flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk Monday; elevated river levels and debris flow may disrupt terminal operations
